001package io.jstach.kiwi.kvs;
002
003import java.net.URI;
004import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Base64;
007import java.util.EnumSet;
008import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.Map;
011import java.util.Objects;
012import java.util.Set;
013
014import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter;
017import io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
018
019/**
020 * Represents a resource that contains key-value pairs to be loaded and processed. A
021 * {@code KeyValuesResource} includes a URI, optional parameters, and metadata flags that
022 * determine its behavior during loading.
023 * <p>
024 * Resources can have special keys associated with them. The most important key is the
025 * load key ({@link #KEY_LOAD}), which assigns a name to the resource. The resource name
026 * is the text following the load key prefix, and the value of the key should be a URI.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * Other keys can be specified in two ways:
030 * </p>
031 * <ol>
032 * <li>As query parameters in the resource's URI (these keys will be removed before the
033 * resource is loaded).</li>
034 * <li>As additional key-value pairs within the same resource, using the resource name as
035 * part of the key (they keys will be removed from the final result).</li>
036 * </ol>
037 *
038 * <em>The parameters are combined from both the URI and key value pairs but the key value
039 * pairs take prededence on collision.</em> One advantage that URI query keys have is that
040 * they do not need the resource name as that can be deduced.
041 *
042 * <table class="table">
043 * <caption><strong>Resource Keys using default syntax</strong></caption> <thead>
044 * <tr>
045 * <th>Constant</th>
046 * <th>Resource Key</th>
047 * <th>URI Query Key</th>
048 * <th>Description</th>
049 * </tr>
050 * </thead> <tbody>
051 * <tr>
052 * <td>{@link io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_LOAD}</td>
053 * <td><code>_load_[resource]</code></td>
054 * <td><strong>N/A</strong></td>
055 * <td>Specifies a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content following
056 * <code>_load_</code>. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
057 * </tr>
058 * <tr>
059 * <td>{@link io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FLAGS}</td>
060 * <td><code>_flags_[resource]</code></td>
061 * <td><code>_flags</code></td>
062 * <td>Defines flags associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
063 * actual resource name.</td>
064 * </tr>
065 * <tr>
066 * <td>{@link io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_MEDIA_TYPE}</td>
067 * <td><code>_mediaType_[resource]</code></td>
068 * <td><code>_mediaType</code></td>
069 * <td>Specifies the media type of a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
070 * actual resource name.</td>
071 * </tr>
072 * <tr>
073 * <td>{@link io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARAM}</td>
074 * <td><code>_param_[resource]_[name]</code></td>
075 * <td><code>_param_[name]</code></td>
076 * <td>Defines parameters associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with
077 * the actual resource name, and <code>[name]</code> with the parameter name, which should
078 * be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
079 * </tr>
080 * <tr>
081 * <td>{@link io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER}</td>
082 * <td><code>_filter_[resource]_[filter]</code></td>
083 * <td><code>_filter_[filter]</code></td>
084 * <td>Specifies filters to apply to a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
085 * actual resource name, and <code>[filter]</code> with the filter identifier, both of
086 * which should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
087 * </tr>
088 * </tbody>
089 * </table>
090 *
091 * <table class="table">
092 * <caption><strong>Resource loading flags</strong></caption> <thead>
093 * <tr>
094 * <th>Flag Value</th>
095 * <th>Description</th>
096 * </tr>
097 * </thead> <tbody>
098 * <tr>
099 * <td>{@value io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}</td>
100 * <td>Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
101 * found. Synonym: {@value io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_OPTIONAL}</td>
102 * </tr>
103 * <tr>
104 * <td>{@value io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_SENSITIVE}</td>
105 * <td>Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
106 * displayed or included in output such as <code>toString</code>.</td>
107 * </tr>
108 * <tr>
109 * <td>{@value io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_ADD}</td>
110 * <td>Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
111 * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.</td>
112 * </tr>
113 * <tr>
114 * <td>{@value io.jstach.kiwi.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE}</td>
115 * <td>Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.</td>
116 * </tr>
117 * </tbody>
118 * </table>
119 *
120 * <em>Note: flags can be negated textual by appending <code>NO_</code> or removing
121 * <code>NO_</code></em>
122 *
123 * Example usage for building a {@code KeyValuesResource}:
124 * {@snippet :
125 * var resource = KeyValuesResource.builder("classpath:/config.properties")
126 *      .name("config")
127 *      .parameter("key1", "value1")
128 *      .sensitive(true)
129 *      .build();
130 * }
131 *
132 * @see KeyValuesSource
133 * @see LoadFlag
134 */
135public sealed interface KeyValuesResource extends NamedKeyValuesSource, KeyValueReference
136                permits InternalKeyValuesResource {
137
138        /**
139         * Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
140         * found.
141         */
142        public static final String FLAG_NO_REQUIRE = "NO_REQUIRE";
143
144        /**
145         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
146         */
147        public static final String FLAG_OPTIONAL = "OPTIONAL";
148
149        /**
150         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
151         */
152        public static final String FLAG_NOT_REQUIRED = "NOT_REQUIRED";
153
154        /**
155         * Indicates that the resource should not be empty. Typically used to enforce that the
156         * resource contains at least one key-value pair.
157         */
158        public static final String FLAG_NO_EMPTY = "NO_EMPTY";
159
160        /**
161         * Specifies that the resource is locked and its properties should not be overridden.
162         * This is distinct from {@link #FLAG_NO_REPLACE}, which has different semantics.
163         */
164        public static final String FLAG_LOCK = "LOCK";
165
166        /**
167         * Ensures that the resource can only add new key-value pairs and cannot replace
168         * existing ones.
169         */
170        public static final String FLAG_NO_REPLACE = "NO_REPLACE";
171
172        /**
173         * Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
174         * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.
175         */
176        public static final String FLAG_NO_ADD = "NO_ADD";
177
178        /**
179         * Indicates that key-value pairs added to variables should not be used for
180         * interpolation purposes.
181         */
182        public static final String FLAG_NO_ADD_VARIABLES = "NO_ADD_VARIABLES";
183
184        /**
185         * Prevents the resource from invoking `_load` calls to load additional child
186         * resources.
187         */
188        public static final String FLAG_NO_LOAD_CHILDREN = "NO_LOAD_CHILDREN";
189
190        /**
191         * Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.
192         */
193        public static final String FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE = "NO_INTERPOLATE";
194
195        /**
196         * Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
197         * displayed or included in output such as `toString`.
198         */
199        public static final String FLAG_SENSITIVE = "SENSITIVE";
200
201        /**
202         * Specifies that the resource should not be reloaded once it has been loaded.
203         */
204        public static final String FLAG_NO_RELOAD = "NO_RELOAD";
205
206        /**
207         * Indicates that the resource's properties should inherit from parent or default
208         * configurations.
209         */
210        public static final String FLAG_INHERIT = "INHERIT";
211
212        /**
213         * Represents the key for specifying resources to load.
214         */
215        public static final String KEY_LOAD = "load";
216
217        /**
218         * Represents the key for specifying flags associated with a resource.
219         */
220        public static final String KEY_FLAGS = "flags";
221
222        /**
223         * Represents the key for specifying the media type of a resource.
224         */
225        public static final String KEY_MEDIA_TYPE = "mediaType";
226
227        /**
228         * Represents the key for specifying parameters associated with a resource.
229         */
230        public static final String KEY_PARAM = "param";
231
232        /**
233         * Represents the key for specifying filters to apply to the resource.
234         */
235        public static final String KEY_FILTER = "filter";
236
237        /**
238         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FLAGS}.
239         */
240        public static final String KEY_FLAG = "flag";
241
242        /**
243         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_MEDIA_TYPE}.
244         */
245        public static final String KEY_MIME = "mime";
246
247        /**
248         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_PARAM}.
249         */
250        public static final String KEY_PARM = "parm";
251
252        /**
253         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FILTER}.
254         */
255        public static final String KEY_FILT = "filt";
256
257        /**
258         * Returns the URI of the resource.
259         * @return the URI of the resource
260         */
261        @Override
262        public URI uri();
263
264        /**
265         * Returns the parameters associated with the resource.
266         * @return the parameters as {@link Parameters}
267         */
268        public Parameters parameters();
269
270        /**
271         * Returns the name of the resource.
272         * @return the name of the resource
273         */
274        @Override
275        public String name();
276
277        /**
278         * Returns the {@link KeyValue} that references this resource, if any.
279         * @return the reference {@code KeyValue}, or {@code null} if not applicable
280         */
281        @Override
282        public @Nullable KeyValue reference();
283
284        /**
285         * Returns the media type of the resource, if specified.
286         * @return the media type, or {@code null} if not specified
287         */
288        public @Nullable String mediaType();
289
290        /**
291         * Creates a builder based on the current state of this {@code KeyValuesResource}.
292         * @return a {@code Builder} initialized with the current state
293         */
294        public Builder toBuilder();
295
296        // TODO maybe we do not provide this.
297        /**
298         * Pretty toString of resource.
299         * @return pretty print resource.
300         */
301        default String description() {
302                return "uri='" + uri() + "' name='" + name() + "'" + ", reference="
303                                + KeyValueReference.toStringRef(this.reference());
304        }
305
306        /**
307         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI.
308         * @param uri the URI for the resource
309         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
310         */
311        public static Builder builder(URI uri) {
312                return new Builder(uri, uriToName(uri));
313        }
314
315        /**
316         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI string.
317         * @param uri the URI string for the resource
318         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
319         */
320        public static Builder builder(String uri) {
321                return builder(URI.create(uri));
322        }
323
324        private static String uriToName(URI uri) {
325                return Base64.getUrlEncoder()
326                        .withoutPadding()
327                        .encodeToString(uri.toASCIIString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.US_ASCII));
328        }
329
330        /**
331         * Builder class for creating instances of {@code KeyValuesResource}.
332         */
333        public final class Builder {
334
335                URI uri;
336
337                String name;
338
339                final Map<String, String> parameters;
340
341                final EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags;
342
343                final List<Filter> filters;
344
345                @Nullable
346                KeyValue reference;
347
348                @Nullable
349                String mediaType;
350
351                Builder(URI uri, String name) {
352                        this.uri = uri;
353                        this.name = DefaultKeyValuesResource.validateResourceName(name);
354                        this.parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>();
355                        this.flags = EnumSet.noneOf(LoadFlag.class);
356                        this.filters = new ArrayList<>();
357                }
358
359                Builder(URI uri, String name, Map<String, String> parameters, EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags,
360                                @Nullable KeyValue reference, @Nullable String mediaType, List<Filter> filters) {
361                        super();
362                        this.uri = uri;
363                        this.name = name;
364                        this.parameters = parameters;
365                        this.flags = flags;
366                        this.reference = reference;
367                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
368                        this.filters = filters;
369                }
370
371                /**
372                 * Sets the URI for the resource.
373                 * @param uri the URI to set
374                 * @return this builder instance
375                 */
376                public Builder uri(URI uri) {
377                        this.uri = uri;
378                        return this;
379                }
380
381                /**
382                 * Sets the name for the resource.
383                 * @param name the name to set
384                 * @return this builder instance
385                 */
386                public Builder name(String name) {
387                        this.name = Objects.requireNonNull(name);
388                        return this;
389                }
390
391                /**
392                 * Clears all parameters associated with the resource.
393                 * @return this builder instance
394                 */
395                public Builder clearParameters() {
396                        parameters.clear();
397                        return this;
398                }
399
400                /**
401                 * Adds a parameter key-value pair to the resource.
402                 * @param key the parameter key
403                 * @param value the parameter value
404                 * @return this builder instance
405                 */
406                public Builder parameter(String key, String value) {
407                        parameters.put(key, value);
408                        return this;
409                }
410
411                /**
412                 * Sets the media type for the resource.
413                 * @param mediaType the media type to set
414                 * @return this builder instance
415                 */
416                public Builder mediaType(String mediaType) {
417                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
418                        return this;
419                }
420
421                /**
422                 * Sets or clears the {@link LoadFlag#NO_INTERPOLATE} flag.
423                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
424                 * @return this builder instance
425                 */
426                public Builder noInterpolation(boolean flag) {
427                        LoadFlag.NO_INTERPOLATE.set(flags, flag);
428                        return this;
429                }
430
431                /**
432                 * Sets or clears the {@link LoadFlag#NO_ADD} flag.
433                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
434                 * @return this builder instance
435                 */
436                public Builder noAddKeyValues(boolean flag) {
437                        LoadFlag.NO_ADD.set(flags, flag);
438                        return this;
439                }
440
441                /**
442                 * Marks the resource as sensitive, meaning its values should not be printed.
443                 * @param flag whether to mark the resource as sensitive
444                 * @return this builder instance
445                 */
446                public Builder sensitive(boolean flag) {
447                        LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.set(flags, flag);
448                        return this;
449                }
450
451                /**
452                 * Marks the resource as not required.
453                 * @param flag true make the resource not required.
454                 * @return this
455                 */
456                public Builder noRequire(boolean flag) {
457                        LoadFlag.NO_REQUIRE.set(flags, flag);
458                        return this;
459                }
460
461                Builder _flags(Set<LoadFlag> flags) {
462                        this.flags.clear();
463                        this.flags.addAll(flags);
464                        return this;
465                }
466
467                Builder _addFlag(LoadFlag flag) {
468                        flags.add(flag);
469                        return this;
470                }
471
472                Builder _addFilter(Filter filter) {
473                        filters.add(filter);
474                        return this;
475                }
476
477                /**
478                 * Parses a comma-separated string of resource flags and adds or removes the flags
479                 * from this builder.
480                 *
481                 * <p>
482                 * See the constants on this class for the available flag names. Flags are
483                 * case-insensitive and can be negated or reversed by prefixing them with
484                 * <code>"NO_"</code> or <code>"NOT_"</code>, or by removing these prefixes if
485                 * they are already present. If a flag is specified multiple times in the input
486                 * string, the last occurrence takes precedence.
487                 * </p>
488                 * <p>
489                 * The following demonstrates how to add and reverse resource flags using this
490                 * method:
491                 * </p>
492                 * {@snippet :
493                 * var builder = KeyValuesResource.builder(URI.create("classpath:/config.properties"));
494                 * builder.addFlags("no_require,no_interpolate,sensitive");
495                 *
496                 * // The flags "NO_REQUIRE", "NO_INTERPOLATE", and "SENSITIVE" are added to the builder.
497                 * }
498                 * @param csv a comma-separated, case-insensitive string of flag names
499                 * @return this builder instance for chaining
500                 */
501                public Builder addFlags(String csv) {
502                        LoadFlag.parseCSV(this.flags, csv);
503                        return this;
504                }
505
506                /**
507                 * Builds and returns a {@code KeyValuesResource} based on the current builder
508                 * state.
509                 * @return a new {@code KeyValuesResource} instance
510                 */
511                public KeyValuesResource build() {
512                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, false);
513                }
514
515                InternalKeyValuesResource buildNormalized() {
516                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, true);
517                }
518
519                // For unit test
520                InternalKeyValuesResource build(KeyValuesResourceParser parser) throws KeyValuesResourceParserException {
521                        return parser.normalizeResource(this.build());
522                }
523
524                @Override
525                public String toString() {
526                        return "KeyValuesResource.Builder[uri=" + uri + ", name=" + name + ", parameters=" + parameters + ", flags="
527                                        + flags + ", reference=" + reference + ", mediaType=" + mediaType + "]";
528                }
529
530        }
531
532}
533
534sealed interface InternalKeyValuesResource extends KeyValuesResource {
535
536        Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags();
537
538        boolean isRedacted();
539
540        public List<Filter> filters();
541
542        boolean normalized();
543
544}
545
546record DefaultKeyValuesResource(URI uri, //
547                String name, //
548                Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags, //
549                @Nullable KeyValue reference, //
550                @Nullable String mediaType, //
551                Parameters parameters, List<Filter> filters, boolean normalized) implements InternalKeyValuesResource {
552
553        DefaultKeyValuesResource {
554                validateResourceName(name);
555                loadFlags = FlagSet.copyOf(loadFlags, LoadFlag.class);
556                filters = List.copyOf(filters);
557        }
558
559        public static String validateResourceName(String identifier) {
560                return KeyValuesSource.validateName(identifier);
561        }
562
563        @Override
564        public Builder toBuilder() {
565                var resource = this;
566                var uri = resource.uri();
567                var name = resource.name();
568                var parameters = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
569                resource.parameters().forKeyValues(parameters::put);
570                var flags = FlagSet.enumSetOf(LoadFlag.class, resource.loadFlags());
571                var ref = resource.reference();
572                var mediaType = resource.mediaType();
573                var filters = resource.filters();
574                var b = new KeyValuesResource.Builder(uri, name, parameters, flags, ref, mediaType, filters);
575                return b;
576        }
577
578        static InternalKeyValuesResource of(KeyValuesResource.Builder builder, boolean normalized) {
579                Map<String, String> parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>(builder.parameters);
580                URI uri = builder.uri;
581                String name = builder.name;
582                var reference = builder.reference;
583                var loadFlags = builder.flags;
584                var mediaType = builder.mediaType;
585                Parameters variables = Parameters.of(parameters);
586                var filters = builder.filters;
587                return new DefaultKeyValuesResource(uri, name, loadFlags, reference, mediaType, variables, filters, normalized);
588        }
589
590        // @Override
591        // public List<Filter> filters() {
592        // var csv = parameters.getValue("filter");
593        // if (csv == null) {
594        // return List.of();
595        // }
596        // List<String> filters = new ArrayList<>();
597        // DefaultKeyValuesMedia.parseCSV(csv, filters::add);
598        // return List.copyOf(filters);
599        // }
600
601        @Override
602        public boolean isRedacted() {
603                // TODO hmm if the resource has sensitive info should its URI be redacated as
604                // well?
605                // if (LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.isSet(loadFlags())) {
606                // return true;
607                // }
608                var ref = this.reference();
609                if (ref == null) {
610                        return false;
611                }
612                return ref.isSensitive();
613        }
614
615}
